name: Embassy Suites Newark - Wilmington/South

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel on Wednesday, August 15, 2007 for one night.
reviews.title: Decent Stay

reviews.text: We arrived after midnight and were very tired with 2 kids.
reviews.title: What a great experience

reviews.text: This is a terrific hotel. I picked it because I was traveling with my kids, and we fit well in the suite-style rooms. But the whole place has a more up-scale feel than I expected. The staff, the pool, the breakfast -- we all loved it.
reviews.title: Very Nice
New Years Eve at Embassy Suites
reviews.text: And it's connected to a TGIFridays, which, with the kids and all, was convenient and fun.

I only stayed one night, so I can't attest to everything. And the hotel isn't anywhere near the quainter parts of Newark or the heart of the university. But I'll be lucky to find a place this nice next time the family travels.
reviews.title: Worst omelet ever!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I visited here the week of New Years Eve and was our first stay here. Excellent property and Staff was very helpful. It is a great area weather was in 50's first 3 days and then got colder so we were able to visit some local state parks. Also visited Longwood Gardens and the Delaware State Natural History Museum.
reviews.title: Ticks all the boxes!

likes.liked: — Clean, comfortable, bright, airy, friendly staff
likes.disliked: — Thin walls, breakfast could be better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was very good we had the cook to order breakfast and attached to hotel is TGIF which was very good because we came back late some nights and they were still open.
reviews.title: Good Stay in Newark

aka: Embassy Suites Newark - Wilmington/South Hotel Newark
